title: Will cash soon be phased out and completely replaced by card payments? - Quora

response.answer_text: No, most people in the cities forget in the country cash is still king. Cash means never having to tell the IRS your sorry. There isn’t any tracking of how cash is spent. This drives big brother crazy. We, as Americans, are far too willing to give up privacy to our govt. Does this sound like paranoia? Not really. If you use social media you have already given up most of your privacy. Why do you think you get ads from companies that you have never heard of? It is not random, social media makes billions off your info. A cashless society tells the Bank, the State, and the Feds where all your money goes. Think about this abstract line of thought.

Socially, this appears to be happening in places, but the government hasn’t pushed it, and it hasn’t become mandatory, and for a few good reasons. For one, poorer people would suddenly lose even more access to performing economic activity of any kind, which is a big problem. For two, not everyone enjoys the Internet as much as would be ideal for a cashless society. Things are moving in that direction, but will they ever be forced to be? We’ll have to wait and see. I already run without cash and it doesn’t stop me from doing basically anything.

Not soon, if ever. Electronic payments are more and more convenient, but at the price of privacy loss. We value our privacy, and may never give it up completely. Cash can be anonymous and private. I think there will always be a need for that.
